meanings.definition: To achieve a high grade or score on a test or exam.
meanings.sent1: She aced the math test with a perfect score.
meanings.sent2: He always aced his science exams effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The student aced the history test and celebrated with a dance.
meanings.sent4: Her study group helped her ace the final exam like a pro.
meanings.sent5: The young girl aced the spelling bee, spelling every word correctly.

meanings.definition: To perform exceptionally well in a particular activity or task.
meanings.sent1: The chef aced the recipe, impressing everyone with the delicious dish.
meanings.sent2: He aced the presentation, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The team aced the project, finishing ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent4: She aced the performance, receiving a standing ovation.
meanings.sent5: The athlete aced the race, crossing the finish line first.
